sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The Rand.Int statement is used to create a pseudo-random integer in the range low to high, inclusive. For example, if i is an integer, after i:=Rand.Int (i,1, 10), i would have a value such as 7 or 2 or 10.
sections.text_content: The Rand.Int statement is used to create a pseudo-random integer in the range low to high, inclusive. For example, if i is an integer, after i:=Rand.Int (i,1, 10), i would have a value such as 7 or 2 or 10.
sections.mdown_content: The **Rand.Int **statement is used to create a pseudo-random integer in the range _low_ to _high_, inclusive. For example, if _i_ is an integer, after _i:=_**Rand.Int **(_i_,1, 10), _i_ would have a value such as 7 or 2 or 10.

sections.title: Example
sections.raw_content: This program simulates the repeated rolling of a six sided die.
sections.text_content: This program simulates the repeated rolling of a six sided die.
sections.mdown_content: This program simulates the repeated rolling of a six sided die.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content:
The Rand.Int statement sets its parameter to the next value of a sequence of pseudo-random integers that approximates a uniform distribution over the range low =i = high. It is required that low = high.

Each time a program runs, Rand.Int uses a different pseudo-random number sequence. To always get the same sequence (actually, to start the sequence at the same point), use the Rand.Set procedure.

To use several sequences of repeatable pseudo-random number sequences, use the Rand.Seed and Rand.Next procedures.
sections.text_content:
The Rand.Int statement sets its parameter to the next value of a sequence of pseudo-random integers that approximates a uniform distribution over the range low =i = high. It is required that low = high.
Each time a program runs, Rand.Int uses a different pseudo-random number sequence. To always get the same sequence (actually, to start the sequence at the same point), use the Rand.Set procedure.
To use several sequences of repeatable pseudo-random number sequences, use the Rand.Seed and Rand.Next procedures.
sections.mdown_content:
The **Rand.Int **statement sets its parameter to the next value of a sequence of pseudo-random integers that approximates a uniform distribution over the range _low_ =_i_ = _high_. It is required that _low_ = _high_.
Each time a program runs, **Rand.Int** uses a different pseudo-random number sequence. To always get the same sequence (actually, to start the sequence at the same point), use the **Rand.Set** procedure.
To use several sequences of repeatable pseudo-random number sequences, use the **Rand.Seed **and **Rand.Next** procedures.

sections.title: Status
sections.raw_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling Rand.Int, not by calling Int.
sections.text_content:
Exported qualified.
This means that you can only call the function by calling Rand.Int, not by calling Int.
sections.mdown_content:
Exported qualified.
This means that you can only call the function by calling **Rand.Int**, not by calling **Int**.
